question: A car accelerates uniformly from rest to $$v = 25 \text{ m/s}$$ in $$t = 10 \text{ s}$$. Calculate its acceleration.
A wave has frequency $$f = 50 \text{ Hz}$$ and wavelength $$\lambda = 0.8 \text{ m}$$. Calculate its speed.
A $$6 \Omega$$ resistor is connected across a $$12 \text{ V}$$ supply. Find the current using Ohm's law.
An object falls freely from rest. After $$t = 3 \text{ s}$$, calculate the distance fallen. (Take $$g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$$)
Three resistors of $$3\Omega$$, $$4\Omega$$, and $$5\Omega$$ are connected in series. Find the total resistance.
Calculate the power dissipated in a $$10\Omega$$ resistor when a current of $$2\text{ A}$$ flows through it.
A sound wave has a frequency of $$340 \text{ Hz}$$ and travels at $$340 \text{ m/s}$$ in air. Calculate the wavelength.
A projectile is launched with initial velocity $$v_0 = 20 \text{ m/s}$$ at an angle of $$30^\circ$$ to the horizontal. Find the maximum height (use $$g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$$).
